title: 5-year-old shot, killed by sibling in Goodlettsville
content:
GOODLETTSVILLE, TN (WSMV) -
Police have released the name of the 5-year-old who was shot and killed in Goodlettsville over the weekend.
According to the Goodlettsville Police Department, the gunshot that struck Andrew Turner was fired by his sibling.
Police say it was not unusual for the children's father to keep a weapon nearby for protection.
The night of the shooting, the father had been playing with the family cat using the laser on the weapon inside their living room at Summerfield Place Apartments.
Police said the man went to the kitchen and forgot to move the weapon out of the children's reach. That's when the sibling allegedly picked up the gun to play with the cat.
He was not familiar with how the laser worked, and he pulled the trigger, firing the round that hit his brother, according to police.
Police said they do not expect any charges to be fired against the sibling. The Davidson County District Attorney’s Office is reviewing the case to see if charges will be filed against the children's father.
